overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors are private landowners in Spotsylvania County with no public record of their positions on local development. None have notable official roles or evident influence in the community, and each neighbor’s stance on the project remains unknown.

neighbors.name: Rettie J. Harding
neighbors.claims: Rettie J. Harding is recorded as the owner of a parcel identified as 44-A-9A in Spotsylvania County’s real estate records [Spotsylvania County Assessment Search](https://apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov/assessment/assessment/index.cfm). No public statements or involvement by Harding in local development issues were found in county meeting archives or news reports [Taxpayers Protection Alliance](https://www.protectingtaxpayers.org/renewable-energy/board-of-supervisors-approves-massive-taxpayer-subsidized-solar-farm-in-spotsylvania-virginia/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through one-on-one outreach on her property, acknowledging her land’s rural character. Emphasize respect for preserving the land’s character and offer visual impact mitigation to address any concerns.

neighbors.name: Rose Lee Gilbert
neighbors.claims: Rose Lee Gilbert is listed as a landowner of parcel 44-4A in Spotsylvania County according to public property records [Spotsylvania County Assessment Search](https://apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov/assessment/assessment/index.cfm). There is no record of Gilbert speaking publicly about local development or energy projects in available news or county minutes [Taxpayers Protection Alliance](https://www.protectingtaxpayers.org/renewable-energy/board-of-supervisors-approves-massive-taxpayer-subsidized-solar-farm-in-spotsylvania-virginia/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach by highlighting how her property and its value will be protected. Provide data or examples to reassure her that local land use and property values won’t be adversely affected by the project.

neighbors.name: Sharon Crabtree
neighbors.claims: Sharon Crabtree is the recorded owner of two adjacent parcels (tax map 44-A-10 and 44-A-10E) in Spotsylvania County [Spotsylvania County Assessment Search](https://apps.spotsylvaniacountyva.gov/assessment/assessment/index.cfm). No documented stance or comments from Crabtree on development or clean energy projects could be found in public sources, suggesting she has not taken a visible role in such debates [Taxpayers Protection Alliance](https://www.protectingtaxpayers.org/renewable-energy/board-of-supervisors-approves-massive-taxpayer-subsidized-solar-farm-in-spotsylvania-virginia/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community liaison meet with her to listen to any concerns about land use changes. Emphasize preservation efforts and landscape buffers to maintain the rural aesthetics she values on her property.
